usefulfunctions

Class ValidateMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • usefulfunctions.ValidateMap

  • public class ValidateMap
extends java.lang.Object
    The ValidateMap class implemented five functions which being used to check entry, exit and path of user-defined map.
    Version:
    1.0.7
    Author:
    Yichen LI

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.LinkedList<java.awt.Point> getCorrectRoute()
      This function returns an ArrayList which contains the path to exit
      static boolean isEntryAdjacent(Tile[][] map)
      This function checks is the entry adjacent to the exit.
      static boolean isExitAdjacent(Tile[][] map)
      This function checks is the exit adjacent to the entry.
      static void setInitFlag(boolean initFlag)
      This function is exclusively used by Junit test to set the flag back to false when each test case ends execution
      static boolean validateEntry(Tile[][] map)
      This function helps to validate whether only one entry exists.
      static boolean validateExit(Tile[][] map)
      This function helps to validate whether only one exit exists.
      static boolean validatePath(Tile[][] map)
      This function helps to validate whether a user-defined path reaches the exit.
